body:
@gstoner @dagamayank, could you help weigh in?

@hawkinsp I think shipping one single binary for 2 different system configurations is something we may have to think twice before doing that. Even on PyPI we can see TensorFlow be shipped in multiple packages: `tensorflow`, `tensorflow-aarch64`, `tensorflow-gpu`, etc. It would be natural to deploy TensorFlow on a ROCm-based system with ROCm-based package (ex: `tensorflow-rocm`).

body_text:
@gstoner @dagamayank, could you help weigh in?
@hawkinsp I think shipping one single binary for 2 different system configurations is something we may have to think twice before doing that. Even on PyPI we can see TensorFlow be shipped in multiple packages: tensorflow, tensorflow-aarch64, tensorflow-gpu, etc. It would be natural to deploy TensorFlow on a ROCm-based system with ROCm-based package (ex: tensorflow-rocm).
